title: Update the Yes-branch follow-up text to remove “white”

requirements.text: Update the Yes-branch follow-up message shown after clicking “Yes” so it does not say “here's white tulips for you” anywhere, and instead displays the exact English string: "You are right — here's tulips for you." (including the em dash and trailing period).

quotes: don't say "here's white tulips for you" but say "here's tulips for you"

acceptanceCriteria: After the user clicks “Yes” (including after the forced-Yes flow), the visible follow-up message text is exactly: "You are right — here's tulips for you."
No user-facing follow-up message in the Yes-branch contains the word "white" in the phrase "here's ... tulips for you"
All other UI behavior (Yes/No branching and existing tulip visuals/animations) remains unchanged

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this text-only update.
nonGoals: Changing tulip/lily image assets or confetti visuals/animations
Introducing new backend logic or persistence
